licensingSteps.title: Complete 90 Hours of Pre-License Education
licensingSteps.desc: Enroll in an ADRE-approved 90-hour pre-license course. This course covers real estate principles, law, and practice in Arizona.

licensingSteps.title: Pass the School Final Exam
licensingSteps.desc: Successfully pass the course final exam with a score of at least 80%. This is required to receive your Pre-Licensure Education Certificate.

licensingSteps.title: Complete the 6-Hour Contract Writing Course
licensingSteps.desc: Take the required 6-hour Introduction to Contract Writing course. This must be completed before applying for your license.

licensingSteps.title: Obtain a Fingerprint Clearance Card
licensingSteps.desc: Apply for a Fingerprint Clearance Card (FCC) through the Arizona Department of Public Safety (DPS). This background check can take several weeks.

licensingSteps.title: Pass the Arizona Real Estate Exam
licensingSteps.desc: Schedule your exam with Pearson VUE. The exam consists of 180 questions, and you must score at least 75% to pass.

licensingSteps.title: Apply for Your Arizona Real Estate License
licensingSteps.desc: Submit your application to the Arizona Department of Real Estate (ADRE) within one year of passing the state exam.

licensingSteps.title: Find a Sponsoring Broker
licensingSteps.desc: To activate your license, you must be hired by an Arizona designated broker who will approve your hiring on the ADRE online system.

eligibility: Must be at least 18 years old
Must provide proof of legal presence in the US
Must obtain a Fingerprint Clearance Card (background check)
educationExam: Pass school final exam (80% or higher)
Pass Arizona state exam (180 questions, 75% to pass)

topics: Real Estate Statutes and Commissioner's Rules
Government Rights and Real Estate Law
exam.prepTip: The Arizona exam is long (5 hours) and comprehensive. Focus heavily on the 6-hour contract writing content and state-specific statutes.

faqs.q: How much does it cost to get a real estate license in Arizona?
faqs.a: Total costs typically range from $550 to $800+. This includes the pre-license course ($350–$600), exam fee ($75), license fee ($60), and fingerprint clearance card (~$67).

faqs.q: How long does it take to become a real estate agent in Arizona?
faqs.a: Most students complete the process in 4 to 10 weeks. The 90-hour course can be finished in as little as 2-3 weeks if studying full-time, but allow extra time for the fingerprint clearance card processing.

faqs.q: What are the requirements for an Arizona real estate license?
faqs.a: You must be at least 18 years old, have legal presence in the US, complete 90 hours of pre-license education plus a 6-hour contract writing course, pass the state exam, and obtain a Fingerprint Clearance Card.

faqs.q: Is the Arizona real estate exam hard?
faqs.a: The Arizona exam is considered challenging due to its length (180 questions) and 5-hour time limit. First-time pass rates hover around 60%. Thorough exam prep is highly recommended.

faqs.q: Can I take the Arizona real estate course online?
faqs.a: Yes, ADRE approves online pre-license courses. Online courses offer flexibility to study at your own pace compared to classroom settings.

faqs.q: Do I need a college degree to be a real estate agent in Arizona?
faqs.a: No, a college degree is not required. You only need to meet the age and education requirements set by the Arizona Department of Real Estate.

faqs.q: How much do real estate agents make in Arizona?
faqs.a: The average annual income for Arizona real estate agents is around $80,000, with top earners making well over $115,000. Income depends on commission splits and sales volume.

faqs.q: What is the 6-hour Contract Writing Course?
faqs.a: It is a mandatory separate course that teaches you how to write and understand Arizona real estate contracts. You must complete this course before applying for your license.

faqs.q: How do I get a Fingerprint Clearance Card in Arizona?
faqs.a: You must apply through the Arizona Department of Public Safety (DPS). This involves submitting an application and having your fingerprints taken by an approved vendor or law enforcement agency.

faqs.q: Can I get an Arizona real estate license with a criminal record?
faqs.a: It is possible, but you must disclose all prior convictions on your application. The ADRE reviews each case individually, and a Fingerprint Clearance Card is required for licensure.
